Articles.Content:
i simple question, in regards to what you prefer more, Khazad-Dum (Moria, Lord Of The Rings), Khaz Modan (Home of the Dwarves, World of/Warcraft), or Kazhakstan (Ex Soviet State, Middle Asian country)

Please, but your answer and reasoning below. Personally, i prefer Khazad-Dum, it being the mightiest city of, arguably, the wealthiest and most powerful empire of Middle Earth, the Dwarrows (Plural of "Dwarf", look it up, bitchwas) at the time of the adventures of Bilbo and Frodo Baggins, and while they may dig to deep, and they have a nasty habit of awakening creatures of shadow and flame, nonetheless, it was the crown jewel of Dwarven Empire
Khazad-Dum too. I'm a huge fan of whatever is LOTR related, I play LOTRO once in a while, and the Moria is simply glorious in the game. Most definitely my favourite area.

Personally, i prefer Khazad-Dum, it being the mightiest city of, arguably, the wealthiest and most powerful empire of Middle Earth, the Dwarrows (Plural of "Dwarf", look it up, bitchwas) at the time of the adventures of Bilbo and Frodo Baggins,
Incorrect. At the time of the adventures of Bilbo and Frodo Moria had long since been abandoned. Look it up.

At least Kazakhstan is better than evil nitwits Uzbekistan! Kazakhstan has superior potassium deposits as well.

You misspelled Kazakhstan, btw.

Edited August 30, 2013 by segaprophet
Kazakhstan, of course, because that is where the Russians launch their rockets!

I almost voted Kazakhstan cuz Rockets!

But in the end I had to vote for LOTR

Incorrect. At the time of the adventures of Bilbo and Frodo Moria had long since been abandoned. Look it up.

Ah, yes, how stupid of me
